bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, November 22, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 22nd, 1889
Mer. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Public Debt, Currency, Receipts and Expenditures of Liberia.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 22nd, 1889
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assitant Secretary, Washington, D.C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith a meager statement concerning the public debt, currency, receipts, and expenditures of Liberia, as furnished this Consulate General by the Secretary of State of LIberia.

The Circular was handled said officer on the 17th of September; and, at the time, a request was made that the information desired be funrished as soon as practicable. The gentleman's attention having been repeatedly called to the same it was returned to this office on the 17th inst with the within enclosure.
I am, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General
1. Statement concerning the Public Debt &c 2. Mer Carclay to Mer. Smith (copy)
